Commit 3edfac2e8663886fe2b3b13e0bec63126bd2a4cb removed the usage
of this method from the API. At at the moment this method is not
invoked and in the future when it is it should pass an instance object.
So there is no need for the object_compat decorator.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I54577885ea57c9321ce029a56844deaed7e0182f
'}]
commit_message:
Compute: remove object_compat from get_instance_diagnostics

Commit 3edfac2e8663886fe2b3b13e0bec63126bd2a4cb removed the usage
of this method from the API. At at the moment this method is not
invoked and in the future when it is it should pass an instance object.
So there is no need for the object_compat decorator.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I54577885ea57c9321ce029a56844deaed7e0182f

subject: Make py35 jobs voting on tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-05 16:45:14.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Make py35 jobs voting on tempest

These jobs work fine on python 3.5, I've personally been running it
with 3.5 locally for almost a year (thanks archlinux :P). So let's
just move these to voting now that we have the infrastructure in place
to run it with 3.5.

Change-Id: Ib3f76bcae93f855cd5b0e52e762c1e6a786cc164
"}]
commit_message:
Make py35 jobs voting on tempest

These jobs work fine on python 3.5, I've personally been running it
with 3.5 locally for almost a year (thanks archlinux :P). So let's
just move these to voting now that we have the infrastructure in place
to run it with 3.5.

Change-Id: Ib3f76bcae93f855cd5b0e52e762c1e6a786cc164

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib for
all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

Change-Id: Iaabc7beaa5891e354b7a8876aa73c488fa86a09b

subject: Add python-watcherclient to global-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 15:40:30.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add python-watcherclient to global-requirements

This dependency is using in rally and as CLI for Watcher.

 1. Is the library actively maintained?

    Yes,
    https://launchpad.net/watcher
    https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-watcherclient

 2. Is the library good code?

    Yes

 3. Is the library license compatible?

    Yes, Apache-2.0

 4. Is the function of this library covered by other libraries?

    No

 5. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
    or infrastructure setup? Which?

    This library is using as CLI for OpenStack Watcher project
    and required in rally to support Watcher load tests.

 6. Is the library python 3 compatible?

    Yes

Change-Id: Ice10dd2879b175ea13ccbef2766d8a12850478d0
'}]
commit_message:
Add python-watcherclient to global-requirements

This dependency is using in rally and as CLI for Watcher.

 1. Is the library actively maintained?

    Yes,
    https://launchpad.net/watcher
    https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-watcherclient

 2. Is the library good code?

    Yes

 3. Is the library license compatible?

    Yes, Apache-2.0

 4. Is the function of this library covered by other libraries?

    No

 5. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
    or infrastructure setup? Which?

    This library is using as CLI for OpenStack Watcher project
    and required in rally to support Watcher load tests.

 6. Is the library python 3 compatible?

    Yes

Change-Id: Ice10dd2879b175ea13ccbef2766d8a12850478d0

commit_message:
Support some binding attributes updating

Add support to update binding profile and vnic type,
apps can use this feature later when they want

In addition, this patch change the format of test_mech_driver.py to
unix format, because it is converted to dos format in master branch

Change-Id: I3d9f22f53be0519a9898ccde4679b8694b50a748

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-06 04:57:26.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': 'Rename binary name of neutron-fwaas to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent.

/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent in neutron-fwaas is clashing with
/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent from python-neutron.

fix it by rename neutron-l3-agent to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent
when enable fwaas.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1595440
Depends-On: I0ace2eecb6406ce5be38bfcc7dbd21c2a93f5925

Change-Id: I74d0be8751baac75476cdc5959817c6edcca0ab7
'}]
commit_message:
Rename binary name of neutron-fwaas to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent.

/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent in neutron-fwaas is clashing with
/usr/bin/neutron-l3-agent from python-neutron.

fix it by rename neutron-l3-agent to neutron-l3-with-fwaas-agent
when enable fwaas.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1595440
Depends-On: I0ace2eecb6406ce5be38bfcc7dbd21c2a93f5925

Change-Id: I74d0be8751baac75476cdc5959817c6edcca0ab7

subject: Fixed create_user_update_password scenario with keystone v3 endpoint
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6835, 'name': 'Kun Huang', 'email': 'gareth@openstacker.org', 'username': 'academicgareth'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 10842, 'name': 'Xiexianbin', 'username': 'xiexianbin', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 13158, 'name': 'Zhongcheng Lao', 'email': 'zlao@vmware.com', 'username': 'zlao'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-14 10:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/test_utils.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/utils.py'], 'message': "Fixed create_user_update_password scenario with keystone v3 endpoint

create_user_update_password failed with keystone v3 endpoint due to
API inconsistency. The method has been changed to users.update in v3
for admin endpoint.

users.update_password is going to update the user's password to which
the token belongs in v3. Unlike v2, It no longer works to update
the user password by admin user.

When calling users.update_password, the user id will
be extracted from the request context in keystone, which is why
users.update_password no longer requires user id to be passed as an arg.
The old password needs to be supplied for authentication.

Rally calls users.update_password in create_user_update_password in v3.
It basically tells keystone to update the admin user's password,
which will result a different behavior to v2.

Besides, user id is wrongly passed as the user's old password in v3,
which result an UnauthorizedException in keystone and fail the test.

This commit will use users.update to update the user password with
admin clients.

Change-Id: I063c0e488a2dddd72ed865c984efcd0fa596a850
Closes-Bug: 1469590
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed create_user_update_password scenario with keystone v3 endpoint

create_user_update_password failed with keystone v3 endpoint due to
API inconsistency. The method has been changed to users.update in v3
for admin endpoint.

users.update_password is going to update the user's password to which
the token belongs in v3. Unlike v2, It no longer works to update
the user password by admin user.

When calling users.update_password, the user id will
be extracted from the request context in keystone, which is why
users.update_password no longer requires user id to be passed as an arg.
The old password needs to be supplied for authentication.

Rally calls users.update_password in create_user_update_password in v3.
It basically tells keystone to update the admin user's password,
which will result a different behavior to v2.

Besides, user id is wrongly passed as the user's old password in v3,
which result an UnauthorizedException in keystone and fail the test.

This commit will use users.update to update the user password with
admin clients.

Change-Id: I063c0e488a2dddd72ed865c984efcd0fa596a850
Closes-Bug: 1469590

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-15 22:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Removes host file contents from DHCP agent logs

The change I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc addressed a
performance impact by removing logging calls from inside the loop that
creates the hosts file in memory. However, it also introduced the
dumping of said hosts file to the logs.

On deployments with a very high number of ports(>5K), this increases the
load of the node substantially. The problem is worse when a high number
of port updates is received in a short amount of time.

There is also the administrative burden caused by the sheer amount of
data being logged.

If the content of the host file is required for debugging purposes, it
can be found at /opt/stack/data/neutron/dhcp/<net-id>/host

This patch is trivial and only removes the logging of the file contents.
The 'building'/'done building' logging calls may still provide useful
information.

Change-Id: Ie176ef123c194c22dca0967a6acfb9a48c959e6c
Closes-Bug: 1557640
"}]
commit_message:
Removes host file contents from DHCP agent logs

The change I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc addressed a
performance impact by removing logging calls from inside the loop that
creates the hosts file in memory. However, it also introduced the
dumping of said hosts file to the logs.

On deployments with a very high number of ports(>5K), this increases the
load of the node substantially. The problem is worse when a high number
of port updates is received in a short amount of time.

There is also the administrative burden caused by the sheer amount of
data being logged.

If the content of the host file is required for debugging purposes, it
can be found at /opt/stack/data/neutron/dhcp/<net-id>/host

This patch is trivial and only removes the logging of the file contents.
The 'building'/'done building' logging calls may still provide useful
information.

Change-Id: Ie176ef123c194c22dca0967a6acfb9a48c959e6c
Closes-Bug: 1557640

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 03:42:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make ovn-native-l3 check job voting

The ovn-native-l3 check job was created as non-voting,
and is now stable with basically the same (low) failure
rate as the ovn voting job.  This should be made voting
and added to the gate since the default implementation of
ovn uses native l3 while the existing voting job uses the
neutron legacy q-l3 agent.

Change-Id: I3e1978b97711e406e34513d8cb7b644f2a361caa
'}]
commit_message:
Make ovn-native-l3 check job voting

The ovn-native-l3 check job was created as non-voting,
and is now stable with basically the same (low) failure
rate as the ovn voting job.  This should be made voting
and added to the gate since the default implementation of
ovn uses native l3 while the existing voting job uses the
neutron legacy q-l3 agent.

Change-Id: I3e1978b97711e406e34513d8cb7b644f2a361caa

commit_message:
devstack: allow ceilometer-api and keystone to run on different hosts

User now can specify CEILOMETER_SERVICE_HOST to a different host so
ceilometer-api and keystone can run on different machines. Also create
keystone accounts in post-config phase, by following gnocchi convention.

Change-Id: Ide55f9e07d4d94e900a3596922da4c40eca8ec3c

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-02 19:38:02.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/eqlx.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_eqlx.py'], 'message': 'EQLX: Extend of snapshot or clone failure

When creating a volume from a snapshot or cloning an existing
volume the driver first creates a new volume of the original
size, then extends the volume if needed to meet the requested
size. The extend call in these operations were passing the
wrong arguments into the extend_volume call, resulting in an
exception being thrown.

Change-Id: I503543fc45a0607d295a2ebe3602436857fc8ff8
Closes-bug: #1598148
'}]
commit_message:
EQLX: Extend of snapshot or clone failure

When creating a volume from a snapshot or cloning an existing
volume the driver first creates a new volume of the original
size, then extends the volume if needed to meet the requested
size. The extend call in these operations were passing the
wrong arguments into the extend_volume call, resulting in an
exception being thrown.

Change-Id: I503543fc45a0607d295a2ebe3602436857fc8ff8
Closes-bug: #1598148

subject: Pass keystone session to clients
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-07 05:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/common/clients.py'], 'message': 'Pass keystone session to clients

Pass keystone session while initializing clients
for integration tests. Swift client does not support
session yet and using keystone session for heat client
results in failure with reload of heat-api in
test_reload_on_sighup functional test.

Change-Id: I9c1e455268bf8c796c9052e428ab02bc67699a0f
'}]
commit_message:
Pass keystone session to clients

Pass keystone session while initializing clients
for integration tests. Swift client does not support
session yet and using keystone session for heat client
results in failure with reload of heat-api in
test_reload_on_sighup functional test.

Change-Id: I9c1e455268bf8c796c9052e428ab02bc67699a0f

commit_message:
Auth plugin for X.509 tokenless authentication

An auth plugin that allows service clients to be authenticated
with the X.509 tokenless authentication. Please find typical configured
options in authentication-plugins.rst

implements bp keystone-tokenless-authz-with-x509-ssl-client-cert

Change-Id: Ie0298f0ef7f3891cfc81072ab9ef9e501773fe5f

subject: Add tests to verify kwargs behavior on revert validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 13:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/test_task.py'], 'message': "Add tests to verify kwargs behavior on revert validation

A bug was reported where a task's revert method was throwing an
'extra args' exception even though it had a **kwargs to slurp up
any extra args.  I added some tests to duplicate the behavior but
the tests all pass.  I'm hoping pushing this up will cause CI to
reproduce the bug so I can diagnose it further.

Change-Id: I9f4d0f065f11370f7981e93349f473df2bb1015d
Closes-Bug: #1589848
"}]
commit_message:
Add tests to verify kwargs behavior on revert validation

A bug was reported where a task's revert method was throwing an
'extra args' exception even though it had a **kwargs to slurp up
any extra args.  I added some tests to duplicate the behavior but
the tests all pass.  I'm hoping pushing this up will cause CI to
reproduce the bug so I can diagnose it further.

Change-Id: I9f4d0f065f11370f7981e93349f473df2bb1015d
Closes-Bug: #1589848

all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

commit_message:
Use request.environ through auth and federation

Use the request.envion property directly rather than the context dict
environment in federation and the linked authentication modules. This
moves us towards removing the environment from the context_dict.

Change-Id: I6862bcdbd435bda03527ffdc93f5f915d50fce1e

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 10:38:35.000000000', 'files': ['glance/location.py', 'glance/quota/__init__.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts
the result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when
you define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when
defining __eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that
the operators will behave as expected

Change-Id: I543e83d49c97f341c27b4dbaac745f94935dc999
Closes-Bug: #1586268
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts
the result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when
you define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when
defining __eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that
the operators will behave as expected

Change-Id: I543e83d49c97f341c27b4dbaac745f94935dc999
Closes-Bug: #1586268

commit_message:
[networking] use explicit release name

'the lastest release' is confusing because it changes depending
on OpenStack releases. Netwokring guide is both for operators and
users, so I think it is reasonable to use OpenStack release name
like Mitaka.

Change-Id: I5c993d277129ff5bfe0506b396c542097ec4055f
(cherry picked from commit 414435039a8a4d94c540b20ca5ff8d54f1a9f7bc)

commit_message:

commit_message:
skip failing tests due to bug 1599333 is fixed

latest osc-lib breaks some of the tests, skip them for now
so we can continue to merge patches that are already approved.

commit_message:
HAProxy: configure either novnc or spice

Instead of having one useless backend, this conditionally deploys what's
needed. This consumes the override set by the deployer.

Closes-Bug: 1539246

commit_message:
Tempest: add a Keystone reseller feature flag

A new tempest test is being added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285541/
but it is not supported in the Kilo and Liberty branches. This patch
turns on this feature flag at Devstacks's side.

According to tempest policies, this patch must be merged first so the
test can actually run.

Change-Id: I52458a0b36e1dba233667311b35f6c3931e2e66c
Depends-On: Ie69dae09c2b42e825e9d51abf158fc14788387d1

commit_message:
Implement router gateway removing

When creating external network in top pod, az hint is passed to
specify which pod bottom external network is located. So plugin
can get bottom router ID with top router ID and bottom pod ID
from resource routing table.

Plugin fist updates router in top pod to remove gateway, then
sends "remove_gateway" request to target bottom pod to update
bottom router.

Change-Id: I69e411188e758016ea789a91298ccd243bdc31cd
(cherry picked from commit 333c99ad20ff2ff647cf2b9a0affaea4bb2eb712)

commit_message:
Implement volume update operation

Controller retrieves the routing entry according to the volume
ID and sends updating request to the correct bottom pod. If
controller gets a 404 error when updating the volume in the
bottom pod, meaning that the bottom volume no longer exists,
controller will remove the routing entry.

Change-Id: I119b0ec31c869179c7c921245c9e06963aa6f866
(cherry picked from commit e380fa85ae88de534ebe3dd69ffceed17500531f)

subject: Implement volume list availability zone filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-12 03:44:50.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/functional/cinder_apigw/controllers/test_volume.py', 'tricircle/cinder_apigw/controllers/volume.py', 'tricircle/common/httpclient.py'], 'message': "Implement volume list availability zone filter

Currently volume list supports most of the filters since it
directly passes filter parameters to bottom pods. But
availability zone filter can not be implememted like that
because we don't require top pod and bottom pod to have
availability zones with the same name. Since each bottom pod
belongs to an availability zone defined in top pod, instead
of passing the availability zone filter to bottom pods, we
directly filter bottom pods by the availability zone filter
then send list request to these filtered bottom pods.

With change in this patch, tempest test test_volumes_list can
be passed.

Change-Id: I8e448a1262ca370ff3bfa9948fee636240a7fb78
(cherry picked from commit fa9db37e645defb8db511092badb759825dbd5f8)
"}]
commit_message:
Implement volume list availability zone filter

Currently volume list supports most of the filters since it
directly passes filter parameters to bottom pods. But
availability zone filter can not be implememted like that
because we don't require top pod and bottom pod to have
availability zones with the same name. Since each bottom pod
belongs to an availability zone defined in top pod, instead
of passing the availability zone filter to bottom pods, we
directly filter bottom pods by the availability zone filter
then send list request to these filtered bottom pods.

With change in this patch, tempest test test_volumes_list can
be passed.

Change-Id: I8e448a1262ca370ff3bfa9948fee636240a7fb78
(cherry picked from commit fa9db37e645defb8db511092badb759825dbd5f8)

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: Ibc7978fd1cfa818d846ca04d94eb7aae2ab789fa
Closes-Bug: #1586268

Gnocchi 2.1 introduces a change where legacy resource types
needed by ceilometer are not created by default. Instead a
new flag is exposed to create these. We should use this by

commit_message:
Use create-legacy-resource-types during gnocchi-upgrade

Gnocchi 2.1 introduces a change where legacy resource types
needed by ceilometer are not created by default. Instead a
new flag is exposed to create these. We should use this by
default. Note that this is an optional flag and is only
needed if you want to create legacy resource types.

Change-Id: I95ccccb40ce4a8319d0776c4d62c2890cf1fd970
Closes-bug: #1592449

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib tenants_client

Tempest 12.1.0 has been released for new library interfaces.
These interfaces are stable[1] and we need to switch using them
instead of current using unstable interfaces.
This will be helpful to avoid breaking gate jobs.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

Change-Id: I74a5d5ed43f758b88a22ded293d85d046005d41f

As per the oslo_i18n documentation, neutron/i18n.py should be an internal
only module, named _i18n.py. This was done in Mitaka release and i18n module
was deprecated since. We could remove the i18n.py now in Newton.

'}]
commit_message:
Remove the file i18n.py and other related cleanups

As per the oslo_i18n documentation, neutron/i18n.py should be an internal
only module, named _i18n.py. This was done in Mitaka release and i18n module
was deprecated since. We could remove the i18n.py now in Newton.

Closes-bug: #1519493

Change-Id: I02e33559cef42d90812d9dbc3dac1d8122897e19

commit_message:
ML2: add a driver-specific dict in the context

We need a way for mechansim driver to pass user-defined
(driver-specific) data from precommit to postcommit.

The simplest way is to add a dict in the context.

Change-Id: Idf6116510a2b5e4469c9fb0cb396127ad44e0c70
Closes-Bug: #1592238

subject: Return 400 when name is more than 255 characters
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-05 04:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/metadef_tags.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_metadef_resources.py', 'glance/api/v2/metadef_namespaces.py', 'glance/api/v2/metadef_objects.py'], 'message': 'Return 400 when name is more than 255 characters

APIs listed below are returning 500 error if you pass name more than
255 characters.
1. metadef tag create
2. metadef property create
3. metadef object create

Added maxLength check in schema to ensure name should not be more than
255 characters.

DocImpact: Earlier for all of the above APIs, maxLength check
for "name" paramerter was not present in schema.
Now all of the above APIs will return 400 HTTPBadRequest
if user passes "name" more than 255 characters.

Partial-Bug: #1585917
Change-Id: Ib85d703442d39a1f5b79b383f6b2dd800b9c7b20
'}]
commit_message:
Return 400 when name is more than 255 characters

APIs listed below are returning 500 error if you pass name more than
255 characters.
1. metadef tag create
2. metadef property create
3. metadef object create

Added maxLength check in schema to ensure name should not be more than
255 characters.

DocImpact: Earlier for all of the above APIs, maxLength check
for "name" paramerter was not present in schema.
Now all of the above APIs will return 400 HTTPBadRequest
if user passes "name" more than 255 characters.

Partial-Bug: #1585917
Change-Id: Ib85d703442d39a1f5b79b383f6b2dd800b9c7b20

Currently iSCSI volume attachment fails if iscsi_use_multipath is
set to True. This is because the encryptor requests cryptsetup
to create the symlink to the LUKS device with the same name of
the device-mapper multipath device. To avoid the name collision,
this patch adds the 'crypt-' prefix to the symlink.

Change-Id: I01a3104025a9c479e40933ca24024355df9dfb8b
Closes-Bug: #1439869
"}]
commit_message:
Fix multipath iSCSI encrypted volume attach failure

Currently iSCSI volume attachment fails if iscsi_use_multipath is
set to True. This is because the encryptor requests cryptsetup
to create the symlink to the LUKS device with the same name of
the device-mapper multipath device. To avoid the name collision,
this patch adds the 'crypt-' prefix to the symlink.

Change-Id: I01a3104025a9c479e40933ca24024355df9dfb8b
Closes-Bug: #1439869

subject: Change default policy to admin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 15:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1593177-8ef35458d29ec93c.yaml', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': 'Change default policy to admin

From: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309346/

"
I investigated the behaviour of the policy file when various policies
are removed.

A completely empty policy file will return a 403 Forbidden. As the user
will not match with any of the policies.

However, because glance has the policy ``default: ""``. It means that
any policy that is not explicitly stated in the the policy.json, is
by default usable by any member. I think that the ``default`` option
is a potentially bad thing to have in the policy.json file, due to the
ability to give permissions without explicitly stating it.
"

Therefore we should change ``"default": "",`` to ``"default":
"role:admin",``. To make sure that members don't inherit policies that
they shouldn't in the future. From a operators perspective it should be
more secure to have an opt-in rather than opt-out.

Change-Id: I57f9d4791126360079a941c1ff4cb2bbb86298d5
Closes-Bug: 1593177
'}]
commit_message:
Change default policy to admin

From: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309346/

"
I investigated the behaviour of the policy file when various policies
are removed.

A completely empty policy file will return a 403 Forbidden. As the user
will not match with any of the policies.

However, because glance has the policy ``default: ""``. It means that
any policy that is not explicitly stated in the the policy.json, is
by default usable by any member. I think that the ``default`` option
is a potentially bad thing to have in the policy.json file, due to the
ability to give permissions without explicitly stating it.
"

Therefore we should change ``"default": "",`` to ``"default":
"role:admin",``. To make sure that members don't inherit policies that
they shouldn't in the future. From a operators perspective it should be
more secure to have an opt-in rather than opt-out.

Change-Id: I57f9d4791126360079a941c1ff4cb2bbb86298d5
Closes-Bug: 1593177

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-25 08:12:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/extensions/l3_ext_ha_mode.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Also change the help text to specify the effect of setting
min_l3_agents_per_router more clearly.

Closes-Bug: 1555042
Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82
'}]
commit_message:
Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Also change the help text to specify the effect of setting
min_l3_agents_per_router more clearly.

Closes-Bug: 1555042
Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82

subject: Remove translation from config options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 13:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/common/config.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/blockbridge.py'], 'message': 'Remove translation from config options

There were a few cases where config option help text was marked
for translation. This text is just used in the generated config
sample and does not ever actually get translated for end user
runtime display. This results in extra strings for the translation
teams to translate with no actual benefit.

Change-Id: I8594533d0e3a61da00bd42ac0f7d8e3da75616fc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove translation from config options

There were a few cases where config option help text was marked
for translation. This text is just used in the generated config
sample and does not ever actually get translated for end user
runtime display. This results in extra strings for the translation
teams to translate with no actual benefit.

Change-Id: I8594533d0e3a61da00bd42ac0f7d8e3da75616fc

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-03 13:03:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v2.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_templated.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_auth.py'], 'message': 'Use skip_test_overrides everywhere we feature skip

Use skip_test_overrides instead of using skipTest for skipping tests
that are not implemented by a particular backend. Then the tests will
let us know that they can be removed when the skipped test is removed.

commit_message:
Use skip_test_overrides everywhere we feature skip

Use skip_test_overrides instead of using skipTest for skipping tests
that are not implemented by a particular backend. Then the tests will
let us know that they can be removed when the skipped test is removed.

This change also found one test could be removed.

Change-Id: I3d6aa0719d2365f65cd1b9b6d6f83be4c5bea2bc

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-01 18:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Support systemd and ceph versions >= 9.2

Currently the devstack ceph plugin uses installation,
configuration, startup, and shutdown commands that do not always
work correctly for Ceph releases after hammer or with systemd
init system.

Check the ceph version and the init system and use appropriate
commands.

Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I25d8816740c6008b076986f3677c299ad9843c30
'}]
commit_message:
Support systemd and ceph versions >= 9.2

Currently the devstack ceph plugin uses installation,
configuration, startup, and shutdown commands that do not always
work correctly for Ceph releases after hammer or with systemd
init system.

Check the ceph version and the init system and use appropriate
commands.

Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I25d8816740c6008b076986f3677c299ad9843c30

commit_message:
Drop common code and add kuryr_lib as requirement

1. Drop the common(COE agnostic) code such as binding, exceptions
2. Renamed kuryr-libnetwork/kuryr to kuryr-libnetwork/kuryr_libnetwork
3. change default kuryr port from 2377 to 23750
4. Add Kuryr-lib(Kuryr) to requirements.txt:
      Kuryr-lib(Kuryr) has also been cleaned to remove libnetwork specific
code(which is active in this repo such as libnetwork api handlers and
test cases). This patch is under review, [1]_. Meanwhile kuryr-lib
dependency is being resolved from external repo [2]. Exacltly same
changes, as present in under review kuryr-lib patch [1], are there on
external repo, [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336784/
[2] https://github.com/vikaschoudhary16/kuryr/tree/drop_libnet_specific_code
Implements blueprint common-code-drop

Change-Id: If0823791463011dc395cd3390a7f4c187c9c2653

commit_message:
Minor reorg of sqlalchemy encrypt test functions

Move the encrypt and decrypt inner functions to the top of the method to
make it obvious that they don't rely on method scoped variables
(except hidden_params_dict). Pass encrypt_value as an argument to decrypt
for its assertions.

Change-Id: I8f1374a91da83d8d1b86c9d75c4492319051da06
Related-Bug: #1479723

commit_message:

horizon, there is an additional policy check added to the base
wizard code.

init. Subclass should overwrite the sequence if it has different order
or new type operation.

subject: Fixes hacking's handling of log hints
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 19:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/ksfixtures/hacking.py', 'keystone/tests/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': "Fixes hacking's handling of log hints

Our hacking check was being a little too specific when ensuring we are
using the proper hints. This code fails because we are expecting that
our code will not use a kwarg in the a raise case:

  msg = _('***')
  LOG.warning(msg)
  raise Exception(message=msg)

Hacking was forcing that msg used _LW(). This check accounts for kwargs
and allows the above code to work.

Change-Id: Id0e7a8dd2773e6c31e3ad034a46e414230312db9
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes hacking's handling of log hints

Our hacking check was being a little too specific when ensuring we are
using the proper hints. This code fails because we are expecting that
our code will not use a kwarg in the a raise case:

  msg = _('***')
  LOG.warning(msg)
  raise Exception(message=msg)

Hacking was forcing that msg used _LW(). This check accounts for kwargs
and allows the above code to work.

Change-Id: Id0e7a8dd2773e6c31e3ad034a46e414230312db9

commit_message:
Refactor compute for new resource/proxy

This change refactors the compute resources and proxy to work with the
newly refactored classes.

Additionally, it adds several properties to the Server resource that
have been documented since it was originally implemented. Several of
these have been requested lately by users, including security_groups,
availability_zone, and admin_password.

Change-Id: I387c9573234c3ed08eb966e388cc2e1a3d891c2d

subject: Allow alternate_id to be accessed directly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 15:43:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/test_resource2.py', 'openstack/resource2.py'], 'message': 'Allow alternate_id to be accessed directly

When a Resource has an alternate_id but not a primary id, its usage is a
bit inconsistent. While we make things work internally, such as when you
do a Resource.get call where we find the alternate_id, you still can't
just call foo.id and get a valid ID back.

The Keypair resource in compute is one of these examples, and its
functional tests are currently failing because they depend on
passing in "sot.id". While they could be engineered around that,
it's certainly a valid usecase to support, and this change
enables it. It does so by implementing __getattribute__ on the Resource
class and then special-casing a request for the "id" name. First we try
to get the primary "id" directly, and if nothing happens there then we
try to get an alternate_id.

Additionally, this changes the special case in the Resource.create
method that was handling any create call with an existing ID as
requiring that it go through the PUT branch when id exists. Relying on
the id value itself being set for determining that branching is
problematic in that these alternate_id resources would then trigger that
path, sending creates which must happen by POST into the PUT branch just
because their alternate_id becomes additionally known as the canonical
id. Instead, we now have put_create as the special case, which is a
fairly rare case as it stands. At least object_store will need to have
its resources set with that flag once it is converted over, though there
may be others as well.

Change-Id: Ia1fd1782f4ad8fa856c16d75bba4d8931307a6e7
'}]
commit_message:
Allow alternate_id to be accessed directly

When a Resource has an alternate_id but not a primary id, its usage is a
bit inconsistent. While we make things work internally, such as when you
do a Resource.get call where we find the alternate_id, you still can't
just call foo.id and get a valid ID back.

The Keypair resource in compute is one of these examples, and its
functional tests are currently failing because they depend on
passing in "sot.id". While they could be engineered around that,
it's certainly a valid usecase to support, and this change
enables it. It does so by implementing __getattribute__ on the Resource
class and then special-casing a request for the "id" name. First we try
to get the primary "id" directly, and if nothing happens there then we
try to get an alternate_id.

Additionally, this changes the special case in the Resource.create
method that was handling any create call with an existing ID as
requiring that it go through the PUT branch when id exists. Relying on
the id value itself being set for determining that branching is
problematic in that these alternate_id resources would then trigger that
path, sending creates which must happen by POST into the PUT branch just
because their alternate_id becomes additionally known as the canonical
id. Instead, we now have put_create as the special case, which is a
fairly rare case as it stands. At least object_store will need to have
its resources set with that flag once it is converted over, though there
may be others as well.

Change-Id: Ia1fd1782f4ad8fa856c16d75bba4d8931307a6e7

subject: Update kolla-kubernetes installation instructions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-30 19:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Update kolla-kubernetes installation instructions

- Provided options for "full install" and "development install".
- Full install is the normal system install
- Development install allows "git pull" within the repository in order
  to use the latest code without having to re-install.  It also
  removes the need to copy files to system directories such as
  /etc/kolla, and allows you to use "git diff" to see all code or
  resource file changes that you or the system has made.
- Fix: ./tools/kolla-genpwd is actually ./tools/generate_passwords.py
- Fix: Original "pip install" of kolla-kubernetes instructions would
  have installed from pypi instead of from the downloaded source.
- Removed instructions and need to set K8S_SERVICE_DIR, which is
  obsoleted by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329676/
- Quickstart instructions now follow through to getting a working
  Keystone.
- Added configuration settings needed for kolla genconfig

Change-Id: Id8bc74c9d3d8663e214e0ccb7a0fb397e3a7b93a
Partially-implements: blueprint documentation-initialization
'}]
commit_message:
Update kolla-kubernetes installation instructions

- Provided options for "full install" and "development install".
- Full install is the normal system install
- Development install allows "git pull" within the repository in order
  to use the latest code without having to re-install.  It also
  removes the need to copy files to system directories such as
  /etc/kolla, and allows you to use "git diff" to see all code or
  resource file changes that you or the system has made.
- Fix: ./tools/kolla-genpwd is actually ./tools/generate_passwords.py
- Fix: Original "pip install" of kolla-kubernetes instructions would
  have installed from pypi instead of from the downloaded source.
- Removed instructions and need to set K8S_SERVICE_DIR, which is
  obsoleted by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329676/
- Quickstart instructions now follow through to getting a working
  Keystone.
- Added configuration settings needed for kolla genconfig

Change-Id: Id8bc74c9d3d8663e214e0ccb7a0fb397e3a7b93a
Partially-implements: blueprint documentation-initialization

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 10705, 'name': 'Darren Chan', 'email': 'dazzachan@yahoo.com.au', 'username': 'daz'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 17799, 'name': 'Logan V', 'email': 'logan2211@gmail.com', 'username': 'Logan2211'}, {'_account_id': 19814, 'name': 'Travis Truman (automagically)', 'email': 'travis_truman@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'trumant'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-07-01 16:41:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/env.d/swift.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/haproxy.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/pkg_repo.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/heat.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/ironic.yml', 'doc/source/developer-docs/inventory.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/intree-and-override-envd-371cf9a809b51fe0.yaml', 'doc/source/developer-docs/extending.rst', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/galera.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/keystone.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/ceilometer.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/swift-remote.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/horizon.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/nova.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/cinder.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/rsyslog.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/rabbitmq.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/memcache.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/infra.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/utility.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/os-infra.yml', 'tests/inventory/env.d', 'doc/source/install-guide/app-custom-layouts.rst', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/shared-infra.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/neutron.yml', 'tests/test_inventory.py', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/glance.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/env.d/aodh.yml'], 'message': "Use in-tree env.d files, provide override support

In past versions, upgrading OpenStack-Ansible lead to contention between
the code base and deployer customizations when env.d files were changed.
Deployers were encouraged to make their customizations, while the
project needed to sometimes adjust architecture. Detecting these
conflicts in an automated way was difficult, since the files were simple
dictionaries and lists, leaving no metadata to describe intent for the
changes.

This change modifies the dynamic inventory system to first use the
in-tree env.d directory as the base environment, then reads in files
from the /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d directory and updates existing keys
with the new values. In this way, the OSA project can modify the
environment and deployers can customize the environment without directly
manipulating the same files.

As part of this change, the env.d directory was moved in to the
playbooks/inventory directory, in order to reduce the path manipulation
done inside of the dynamic_inventory.py script. The example files were
left in the etc/openstack_deploy directory for reference.

Note that this change supports deleting elements by specifying a
empty value, such as an empty list or an empty dictionary.

When overriding, only the path to the values that changed is necessary.
For example, changing the 'is_metal' property for cinder only needs the
following in /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder.yml:

    container_skel:
      cinder_volumes_container:
        properties:
          is_metal: false

This is instead of the entirity of the container_skel dict or even the
other top-level dicts.

For AIO/gate scenarioes, the env.d copy logic has been removed, as it is
now redundant.

Change-Id: Ic637fa385fd3fec7365fb9bc5e0ff54a7f4c8bee
"}]
commit_message:
Use in-tree env.d files, provide override support

In past versions, upgrading OpenStack-Ansible lead to contention between
the code base and deployer customizations when env.d files were changed.
Deployers were encouraged to make their customizations, while the
project needed to sometimes adjust architecture. Detecting these
conflicts in an automated way was difficult, since the files were simple
dictionaries and lists, leaving no metadata to describe intent for the
changes.

This change modifies the dynamic inventory system to first use the
in-tree env.d directory as the base environment, then reads in files
from the /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d directory and updates existing keys
with the new values. In this way, the OSA project can modify the
environment and deployers can customize the environment without directly
manipulating the same files.

As part of this change, the env.d directory was moved in to the
playbooks/inventory directory, in order to reduce the path manipulation
done inside of the dynamic_inventory.py script. The example files were
left in the etc/openstack_deploy directory for reference.

Note that this change supports deleting elements by specifying a
empty value, such as an empty list or an empty dictionary.

When overriding, only the path to the values that changed is necessary.
For example, changing the 'is_metal' property for cinder only needs the
following in /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder.yml:

    container_skel:
      cinder_volumes_container:
        properties:
          is_metal: false

This is instead of the entirity of the container_skel dict or even the
other top-level dicts.

For AIO/gate scenarioes, the env.d copy logic has been removed, as it is
now redundant.

Change-Id: Ic637fa385fd3fec7365fb9bc5e0ff54a7f4c8bee

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 18:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/release_managed.rst'], 'message': 'remove release:managed tag

The release:managed tag used to describe projects fully managed by the
release management team. With the new automation and changes to our
release processes, we have expanded the list of projects that are
"managed" in this sense to all official project teams using cycle-based
release models. This tag has therefore become redundant, and can be
removed.

Change-Id: I51a242c2c706fd3040af0dea391175ef5206aa6b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove release:managed tag

The release:managed tag used to describe projects fully managed by the
release management team. With the new automation and changes to our
release processes, we have expanded the list of projects that are
"managed" in this sense to all official project teams using cycle-based
release models. This tag has therefore become redundant, and can be
removed.

Change-Id: I51a242c2c706fd3040af0dea391175ef5206aa6b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-07-04 20:21:07.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/api-paste.ini', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/microversion.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/microversion.py'], 'message': "Add microversion support for the placement API

The microversion_parse library is used in a WSGI middleware
to parse incoming microversion headers and place the
determined value into the WSGI environment at the
'placement.microversion' key. Response headers are adjusted to
add the required outgoing headers as described in:

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html

If a client requests an invalid or unavailable microversion, they
will receive a 406 response. The format of that response is
dependent on the accept header of the request.

Thus far nothing else is done with the microversion information.
It is there for when we need it in the future. For now everything
is version 1.0.

Change-Id: Id4765cdbb865571be6261c31a15d0b4d9bb0a876
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Add microversion support for the placement API

The microversion_parse library is used in a WSGI middleware
to parse incoming microversion headers and place the
determined value into the WSGI environment at the
'placement.microversion' key. Response headers are adjusted to
add the required outgoing headers as described in:

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html

If a client requests an invalid or unavailable microversion, they
will receive a 406 response. The format of that response is
dependent on the accept header of the request.

Thus far nothing else is done with the microversion information.
It is there for when we need it in the future. For now everything
is version 1.0.

Change-Id: Id4765cdbb865571be6261c31a15d0b4d9bb0a876
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
Split Heat pacemaker roles into separate services

In order for each service to operate independently when used with Pacemaker,
the roles needed to be separated.

This also drops all pacemaker constraints, as they do not make much sense
in the composable realm.

Change-Id: I3fa76562c13191884a53848ad5adcbc9f5a24f61

subject: Update overcloud dns servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 10:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo/undercloud/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update overcloud dns servers

They were pointing to google, so they were not operative.
It was also causing slowness when connecting via ssh, because
it was trying to resolve undercloud address, and nameservers
were not responding.

Switch to use external network gateway, by this way ssh is
fast and instances can resolve properly.

Change-Id: I8a03e07f259fd92a4219f6d65e47e07044657945
Closes-Bug: 1598722
'}]
commit_message:
Update overcloud dns servers

They were pointing to google, so they were not operative.
It was also causing slowness when connecting via ssh, because
it was trying to resolve undercloud address, and nameservers
were not responding.

Switch to use external network gateway, by this way ssh is
fast and instances can resolve properly.

Change-Id: I8a03e07f259fd92a4219f6d65e47e07044657945
Closes-Bug: 1598722

subject: Make virt pool creation more robust and less susceptible to failures
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-05 17:21:57.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/teardown/nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/overcloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Make virt pool creation more robust and less susceptible to failures

See https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvirt-users/2016-March/msg00123.html
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-quickstart/+bug/1577809
We continue to hit this issue even w/ the current clean up.  This additional

* remove any remaining virt pool information from previous installs in /run/user
* before creating the pool test for it's existence.

Note: need to have Lars review this patch.

Change-Id: I0eda9d169103d30e8d5ef6fba9e146cd3d0a4cc9
"}]
commit_message:
Make virt pool creation more robust and less susceptible to failures

See https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvirt-users/2016-March/msg00123.html
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-quickstart/+bug/1577809
We continue to hit this issue even w/ the current clean up.  This additional

* remove any remaining virt pool information from previous installs in /run/user
* before creating the pool test for it's existence.

Note: need to have Lars review this patch.

Change-Id: I0eda9d169103d30e8d5ef6fba9e146cd3d0a4cc9

commit_message:
Tempest API tests using testscenarios for create/update loadbalancer

Introducing tempest data-driven scenario tests for validating attributes when:

(a) create loadbalancer with:
    (i) admin_state_up as True
    (ii) admin_state_up as False

(b) update loadbalancer with:
    (i) update lb when default admin_state_up is true
    (ii) update lb when default admin_state_up is false

Change-Id: I39ec1754967bc56ecc0cf1633f21773c544289b5
Co-Authored-By: Franklin Naval  <franklin.naval@RACKSPACE.COM>

commit_message:
run_tests: checkout tempest from master on Ubuntu

On Ubuntu, come back to Tempest master.
So we have to disable Sahara and Neutron FWaaS now, as we need more
recent packaging in UCA, that will be provided after N2.

subject: pacemaker: don't override Service resource for Nova & Neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 12:27:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "pacemaker: don't override Service resource for Nova & Neutron

Nova & Neutron services are already managed by puppet-tripleo in
profiles, and we already override Service resource for some services to
manage them with Pacemaker.
Dropping this code here will allow us to run TripleO in AIO setup as we
don't manage everything with Pacemaker.

Change-Id: Idcfc6ea26ca41534ce407be0eb3dafe7bcd2ef2d
"}]
commit_message:
pacemaker: don't override Service resource for Nova & Neutron

Nova & Neutron services are already managed by puppet-tripleo in
profiles, and we already override Service resource for some services to
manage them with Pacemaker.
Dropping this code here will allow us to run TripleO in AIO setup as we
don't manage everything with Pacemaker.

Change-Id: Idcfc6ea26ca41534ce407be0eb3dafe7bcd2ef2d

subject: Extend test_hashes to allow extra info gathering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 14:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fixture.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fixture.py'], 'message': 'Extend test_hashes to allow extra info gathering

ObjectVersionChecker.get_hashes() already support extra data collection
for fingerprint generation via the extra_data_func parameter.
However this cannot be used from test_hashes().

Nova versioned notification work depends on this extra data gathering
support. See nova bug #1595575

Change-Id: I7f4d0f37e638de6fcef7211280cedd7d1f09ab74
Closes-Bug: #1595552
'}]
commit_message:
Extend test_hashes to allow extra info gathering

ObjectVersionChecker.get_hashes() already support extra data collection
for fingerprint generation via the extra_data_func parameter.
However this cannot be used from test_hashes().

Nova versioned notification work depends on this extra data gathering
support. See nova bug #1595575

Change-Id: I7f4d0f37e638de6fcef7211280cedd7d1f09ab74
Closes-Bug: #1595552

commit_message:
Add string checking param to LBaaSv2 healthmonitor

Neutron LBaaSv2 healthmonitor allows validation of the HTTP return code within
the member reply.
Loadbalancers allow an addional validation, where the existence of a string
within the member response determines the member health status.
This patch adds the necessary param for the validation above.

Change-Id: Ie6b58a4f885fb0906b342696675005a23c7cdb60
Fixes-Bug: #1523231

subject: Make note template follow correct formatting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 16:08:11.000000000', 'files': ['reno/create.py'], 'message': 'Make note template follow correct formatting

The template used to create a new release note does not follow the ReST
standards[0]. This can be confusing to a contributor who may be
unfamiliar with the formatting requirements, as they will tend to follow
the template format, and end up with incorrect ReST. This patch adds the
required vertical bar and newline to each section.

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html#formatting

Change-Id: Ie8cbe524376a3c3e1e11446abdc6e5fa00233d51
'}]
commit_message:
Make note template follow correct formatting

The template used to create a new release note does not follow the ReST
standards[0]. This can be confusing to a contributor who may be
unfamiliar with the formatting requirements, as they will tend to follow
the template format, and end up with incorrect ReST. This patch adds the
required vertical bar and newline to each section.

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html#formatting

Change-Id: Ie8cbe524376a3c3e1e11446abdc6e5fa00233d51

subject: Disable libvirt tunnelled migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 15:20:43.000000000', 'files': ['templates/mitaka/nova.conf'], 'message': 'Disable libvirt tunnelled migrations

Selective live block migration between compute instances
is only supported if libvirt tunnelled migrations are
disabled; migration is still secure (over SSH).

This allows instances with local ephemeral storage and
remote block devices (such as presented by ceph) to be
migrated.

Closes-Bug: 1599205

Change-Id: I1560e11bac9ee5dabb8d6b6e393a31a2f3c9aa74
'}]
commit_message:
Disable libvirt tunnelled migrations

Selective live block migration between compute instances
is only supported if libvirt tunnelled migrations are
disabled; migration is still secure (over SSH).

This allows instances with local ephemeral storage and
remote block devices (such as presented by ceph) to be
migrated.

Closes-Bug: 1599205

Change-Id: I1560e11bac9ee5dabb8d6b6e393a31a2f3c9aa74

subject: JSON schema get_schema implementation for common fields
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-06-30 21:37:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': "JSON schema get_schema implementation for common fields

This implements the get_schema method of common Field and FieldType classes.
This method will be used by the to_json_schema method in Versioned objects
to partially generate the schema of the object's fields.
Fields implemented in this patch: string, enum, integer, float, boolean, list

This also fixes check for default value for Field.

Implements blueprint json-schema-for-versioned-object

Change-Id: Ibd84cb4e33c375044611c6ffa137ee67d21a93e5
"}]
commit_message:
JSON schema get_schema implementation for common fields

This implements the get_schema method of common Field and FieldType classes.
This method will be used by the to_json_schema method in Versioned objects
to partially generate the schema of the object's fields.
Fields implemented in this patch: string, enum, integer, float, boolean, list

This also fixes check for default value for Field.

Implements blueprint json-schema-for-versioned-object

Change-Id: Ibd84cb4e33c375044611c6ffa137ee67d21a93e5

subject: Add new posix element.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-20 17:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['elements/posix/README.rst', 'elements/posix/package-installs.yaml', 'elements/posix/pkg-map', 'elements/posix/element-deps'], 'message': 'Add new posix element.

This element installs package to ensure that the resulting image
provides the binaries outlined in posix specification [1]. This solves
some problems such as cron missing from the ubuntu-minimal images, and
hopefully minimizing the problems from similar problems in the future.

This is the image size difference:

Resulting qcow image sizes:

                Ubuntu      Ubuntu-Minimal    Debian    Centos7
        None    334MB       330MB             352MB     470MB
        Posix   353MB       375MB
        Posix+  354MB       374MB             406MB     471MB

        Posix+ = Posix + gcc + cssc

[1] http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/idx/utilities.html

Change-Id: I2a8f77bf8a0fdb04b328e56425d43a60eb3f7eed
'}]
commit_message:
Add new posix element.

This element installs package to ensure that the resulting image
provides the binaries outlined in posix specification [1]. This solves
some problems such as cron missing from the ubuntu-minimal images, and
hopefully minimizing the problems from similar problems in the future.

This is the image size difference:

Resulting qcow image sizes:

                Ubuntu      Ubuntu-Minimal    Debian    Centos7
        None    334MB       330MB             352MB     470MB
        Posix   353MB       375MB
        Posix+  354MB       374MB             406MB     471MB

        Posix+ = Posix + gcc + cssc

[1] http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/idx/utilities.html

Change-Id: I2a8f77bf8a0fdb04b328e56425d43a60eb3f7eed

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14957, 'name': 'Brad Behle', 'email': 'behle@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'behle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 18:19:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': "De-dup user-defined SG rules before iptables call

A port may be a member of multiple security groups. These
security groups may have dupilcate rules between them
(e.g. they both allow all EGRESS traffic). If the iptables
manager is called with duplicated rules, it emits a warning
of a possible bug in the rule generation code because it
doesn't expect there to be duplicated rules.

This patch fixes this by de-duplicating user-defined security group
rules before dispatching the calls to the iptables_manager.

Change-Id: I98dbe60df1bcf68b9922deee63dd0328c4c10dd0
Closes-Bug: #1565705
(cherry picked from commit 142b68f0757ab036d56bc9b4563b7a4481527deb)
"}]
commit_message:
De-dup user-defined SG rules before iptables call

A port may be a member of multiple security groups. These
security groups may have dupilcate rules between them
(e.g. they both allow all EGRESS traffic). If the iptables
manager is called with duplicated rules, it emits a warning
of a possible bug in the rule generation code because it
doesn't expect there to be duplicated rules.

This patch fixes this by de-duplicating user-defined security group
rules before dispatching the calls to the iptables_manager.

Change-Id: I98dbe60df1bcf68b9922deee63dd0328c4c10dd0
Closes-Bug: #1565705
(cherry picked from commit 142b68f0757ab036d56bc9b4563b7a4481527deb)

commit_message:
Add TripleO 2-node job

Adds a new CI job in the experimental-tripleo queue using multinode
nodepool jobs. The job uses 1 subnode to deploy via TripleO. The
jenkins slave is purposed as the undercloud, and an all in one Overcloud
is deployed on the subnode.

Note that support for multinode jobs is being added to tripleo-ci in this
patch: Icc67a289df207348536c0a2419b3fc81f03fe758

Change-Id: I8375a96a4f4394b0a0d233731f7f4b386c0d5c71

subject: pickle_async_update should create tmp_dir
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 08:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'pickle_async_update should create tmp_dir

While creating a probe test for the expirer daemon, I found
the following error scenario:

1. Introduce a new object server. Initially it doesn't have a tmp_dir.
2. Have the object-replicator replicate some objects, one of them
    with an expiration (X-Delete-At).
3. Send a DELETE request for the expired object.

While beginning to process the DELETE request, the fresh
object server still doesn't have a tmp_dir created.
Since the object has an old expiration value, the object server
will first call "delete_at_update", before creating a tombstone.
delete_at_update then must create an async_pending,
which will lead to an IO error, since tmp_dir doesn't exist.

As said, I have witnessed this in practice in the probe test I wrote
at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326903/.

This patch changes pickle_async_update behavior to create
tmp_dir, in case it doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I88b0e5f75a2a28d6880694ff327ac2763c816d24
'}]
commit_message:
pickle_async_update should create tmp_dir

While creating a probe test for the expirer daemon, I found
the following error scenario:

1. Introduce a new object server. Initially it doesn't have a tmp_dir.
2. Have the object-replicator replicate some objects, one of them
    with an expiration (X-Delete-At).
3. Send a DELETE request for the expired object.

While beginning to process the DELETE request, the fresh
object server still doesn't have a tmp_dir created.
Since the object has an old expiration value, the object server
will first call "delete_at_update", before creating a tombstone.
delete_at_update then must create an async_pending,
which will lead to an IO error, since tmp_dir doesn't exist.

As said, I have witnessed this in practice in the probe test I wrote
at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326903/.

This patch changes pickle_async_update behavior to create
tmp_dir, in case it doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I88b0e5f75a2a28d6880694ff327ac2763c816d24

the operation, failed, report the original exception
rather than the one from delete_router.  The former is
more likely useful for users.  Besides that, it's critical
to preserve the original exception for special exceptions

commit_message:
create_router: Report the original exception

In case delete_router, which is an attempt to revert
the operation, failed, report the original exception
rather than the one from delete_router.  The former is
more likely useful for users.  Besides that, it's critical
to preserve the original exception for special exceptions
like RetryRequest.

Also, add some relevant unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1490917
Change-Id: I1cef944115c1911d4b7e60fb4dff389b1911ddbb

When a vif will be plugged into an OVS bridge, ensure that the bridge
exists during the plugging operation. In most cases, the OVS bridge will
already exist at the time of port creation, so this will be a no-op.
However, the OVS agent implementation for vlan-aware VMs will require
the os-vif plugin to create the OVS bridge if it doesn't already exist,
because vifs that correspond to trunk ports won't be directly plugged
into br-int.

Change-Id: I3cb61a5e842177a26f38c85d7782ecced4ac07da
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure the OVS bridge exists when plugging

When a vif will be plugged into an OVS bridge, ensure that the bridge
exists during the plugging operation. In most cases, the OVS bridge will
already exist at the time of port creation, so this will be a no-op.
However, the OVS agent implementation for vlan-aware VMs will require
the os-vif plugin to create the OVS bridge if it doesn't already exist,
because vifs that correspond to trunk ports won't be directly plugged
into br-int.

Change-Id: I3cb61a5e842177a26f38c85d7782ecced4ac07da

commit_message:
Service user permissions

When the service token is specified auth_token middleware should trust
the headers it receives in the most recent request rather than
validating the user token again.

Change-Id: I64296016757f15632651f9a99f0118318f698ff3

commit_message:
Fix VPNaaS functional tests

Change Ie27cf174fa24c2f479af47335d9ae139fb7d159a broke functional
testing by changing the location and name of MySQLTestCase and
PostgresSQLTestCase.  Point code to the new name and location.

Side effect, all TestIPSecScenario tests have been decorated to
be skipped because of bug 1598466 to allow this patch to merge
reliably.

Change-Id: I0dd36bc60b974a3f76307ef312e3d5b0a79bca40
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 05:30:56.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I5485022f010cdcb88c0d4ebe5c44a39a1bf242b0
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I5485022f010cdcb88c0d4ebe5c44a39a1bf242b0

commit_message:
VMware: create vif with resource limitations

Change Id321ffcb17114b53141f2489156869d418b768fd allows to
create instance with vif having resource limitations.

This patch adds ability to derive the network resource
allocation (quota:vif_reservation, quota:vif_limit,
quota:vif_shares_level, quota:vif_shares_share) from
flavor extra specs while attaching new interfaces to an instance.

Implements: blueprint vmware-limits-newton

Change-Id: Ib090ac3d1e007ab33a2ff5ff37f731e40c113621

commit_message:
Make plugin collection time warning value configurable

Allow the value of sub_collection_warn to be configurable using
monasca_setup. However, use the name plugin_collect_time_warn
as the configuration option since that is easier to understand

commit_message:
Use NO_MONITOR status for member creation

When adding a member to a pool that does not have an active health
monitor, utilize the NO_MONITOR status.  This will remove confusion around
the true operating status of the member.

Change-Id: Id5ba7e982f7159fbcf1100a011aa81b1b1b3757e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 11:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add django-floppyforms, advanced Django Forms extension

This library provides capabilities for advanced rendering of Django Forms.

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes:
    https://github.com/gregmuellegger/django-floppyforms/graphs/contributors

- Is the library good code?

  The code is simple, small, mature and covered with tests, under CI.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  The library supports versions from 2.6 to 3.5 and PyPy.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The library is BSD licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu 16.X: Not packaged
  Fedora 24: Not packaged

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  This library is required for this change:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175215/

  And this blueprint:
    https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/assign-category-button

Change-Id: Ie65a77eab29aa191420fbd630b1d242b59c9ff9f
'}]
commit_message:
Add django-floppyforms, advanced Django Forms extension

This library provides capabilities for advanced rendering of Django Forms.

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes:
    https://github.com/gregmuellegger/django-floppyforms/graphs/contributors

- Is the library good code?

  The code is simple, small, mature and covered with tests, under CI.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  The library supports versions from 2.6 to 3.5 and PyPy.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The library is BSD licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu 16.X: Not packaged
  Fedora 24: Not packaged

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  This library is required for this change:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175215/

  And this blueprint:
    https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/assign-category-button

Change-Id: Ie65a77eab29aa191420fbd630b1d242b59c9ff9f

commit_message:
Adjust smoke test to search in examples directory.

The latest puppet recommendation are for examples of working manifest to
be put in the examples directory.  This patch ensure that we first
search this one before moving on the tests directory, for backward
compatibility.

Change-Id: I2699eaa3a10589c9a0c680bb1de489994fe01b67

subject: Allow kubectl to use its own configured endpoint for kube API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 00:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/service.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/config.py'], 'message': 'Allow kubectl to use its own configured endpoint for kube API

Right now, kolla-kubernetes overrides the kube API endpoint by feeding
kubectl the --server option.  We should not do this, which currently
hardcodes to use the localhost:8080 hyperkube endpoint.  This is
unexpected for the operator.  Allow kubectl to use its own configured
endpoint for kube API.

Change-Id: I39db523335126fe77abf3cb089e8f6d3965f76f4
'}]
commit_message:
Allow kubectl to use its own configured endpoint for kube API

Right now, kolla-kubernetes overrides the kube API endpoint by feeding
kubectl the --server option.  We should not do this, which currently
hardcodes to use the localhost:8080 hyperkube endpoint.  This is
unexpected for the operator.  Allow kubectl to use its own configured
endpoint for kube API.

Change-Id: I39db523335126fe77abf3cb089e8f6d3965f76f4

commit_message:
Deprecate migration flags parameters

The correct live and block migration flags can be inferred
from the new live_migration_tunnelled config option.
live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag will be removed
to avoid potential misconfiguration.

Change-Id: I523d351900ee7852875e94e1d5d5cffb76935f11

subject: Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10386, 'name': 'OpenDaylight CI', 'email': 'odl-openstack@opendaylight.org', 'username': 'odl-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-27 20:30:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6
'}]
commit_message:
Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6

subject: Convergence: Fix concurrent update resource delete
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6899, 'name': 'Sirushti Murugesan', 'email': 'sirushtim@gmail.com', 'username': 'sirushtim'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 10487, 'name': 'Kanagaraj Manickam', 'email': 'mkr1481@gmail.com', 'username': 'kanagarajm'}, {'_account_id': 11424, 'name': 'Rakesh H S', 'email': 'rakeshhs1@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakesh'}, {'_account_id': 12259, 'name': 'Anant Patil', 'email': 'anant.techie@gmail.com', 'username': 'ananta'}, {'_account_id': 20066, 'name': 'Soumiyajit', 'email': 'soumiyajit@nectechnologies.in', 'username': 'Soumiyajit'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-07-05 06:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_check_resource.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/engine/check_resource.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Convergence: Fix concurrent update resource delete

In convergence, wherein concurrent updates are possible, if a resource
is deleted (by previous traversal) after dependency graph is created
for new traversal, the resource remains in graph but wouldn't be
available in DB for processing.
It is prerequisite to have resources in DB before any action can be
taken on them.

Hence during convergence resource delete action, the resource entry
from DB is not deleted i.e soft deleted, so that the latest/new update
can find the entry.
All of these soft deleted resources will be deleted when the stack has
completed its operation.

Closes-Bug: #1528560
Change-Id: I0b36ce098022560d7fe01623ce7b66d1d5b38d55
"}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Fix concurrent update resource delete

In convergence, wherein concurrent updates are possible, if a resource
is deleted (by previous traversal) after dependency graph is created
for new traversal, the resource remains in graph but wouldn't be
available in DB for processing.
It is prerequisite to have resources in DB before any action can be
taken on them.

Hence during convergence resource delete action, the resource entry
from DB is not deleted i.e soft deleted, so that the latest/new update
can find the entry.
All of these soft deleted resources will be deleted when the stack has
completed its operation.

Closes-Bug: #1528560
Change-Id: I0b36ce098022560d7fe01623ce7b66d1d5b38d55

commit_message:
Fix mysql setup for Xenial jobs

"mysql -h 127.0.0.1" doesn't, so change the setup call accordingly.

commit_message:
Move rabbit option settings from DEFAULT to oslo_messaging_rabbit

oslo.messaging has deprecated the use of rabbit_* option settings
at the [DEFAULT] section in config file. This commit moves
the rabbit option settings to a [oslo_messaging_rabbit] section in
each of the relevant trove service when run 'devstack/plugin.sh'.

Closes-Bug: 1528391
Change-Id: Id60ea94a53ad96293846f252201416ad5b8e833d
